Posts.Content: On Jan 16, 2015 6:31 PM EvWallace wrote: On Jan 16, 2015 4:20 PM boc0913 wrote: Sorry to hear about your reaction.  Wondering if you could give me some advice.  Found out they want me to take it as well.  Have a very low, low risk, and I'm not sure it is worth the side effects.  I've just recently developed severe allegies to antibiotibics, so reading this really helped.  Wondering what other side effects you've had over 5 months.  I'm just not convinced I should be on it.....so anything you can contribute would be helpful in my decision making.  Any chance for you they would try a different med....something similar?  What happens if you react again?  Hope you feel better soon.  We all have enough to deal with, without reactions like that! I also have a very low risk of cancer returning, however, I have been told numerous times by many different Cooper cancer doctors that it is strongly advised to take one of these drugs for 5 to 10 years due to chance of recurrance.  I've had several side effects so far from Anastrazole.  Started with hot flashes almost right away.  Those lessened after about a month to 6 weeks.  Next came the sleeplessness.  That was pretty bad for a while.  Then came hair loss and now this rash.  They will be putting me on another drug after 2 weeks.  Hope that this helped. I was diagnosed with dcis back in January 2016,had a lumpectomy upon which they found an area that had iinvasive cancer cells. Lucky it was very early. The docs took it out and after spendiing 5 weeks of radiation, I was on anastrozole. I started on june 1st. felt the irratablility almost immediately, the next day was horrible.. bitchiness.  As if that wasn't enough, 4 days later I got the rash/hives that started in my buttock area radiating up my back and down my leggs.  I could actually feel/see it moving to my toes and fingers.  I was taken off the meds and feel a lot better but I will be seeing my doc next week and I know that she will be recommeding that I try another kind of meds ( slight change in the formulation,she says). So From what i am reading, different formulation of the medication doesn't matter, the side effects will be the same. Is there any one med that is less intense?

Posts.Content: I just turned 55 and was diagnosed with early stage one breast cancer and had been on anastazole for 3 days and developed a major rash. I was taken of the med and on weds i am going to talk to my doc about other medications available. After reading all that you are going thru.. i am scared ---less!!! My kids are still very young and I would like to enjoy spending time with them like hiking, swimming and even running the marathon. But if I take these drugs i may be just sitting on the sidelines in a chair and living a fruitful life.. any suggestions??
